channel.title: VCS Tracker - The database for the voluntary sector.
channel.description: VCS Tracker is a powerful voluntary sector database. It allows you to monitor, analyse and connect with your local voluntary and community sector.

item.title: Communicating via VCS Tracker
item.description: VCS Tracker is able to send targeted emails to individual and multiple contacts on the database.  The following pages introduce the main communication tools (sending an email/letter to single or multiple contacts) and provides information about how to set an individual's mailing preferences.
item.dc:creator: martin.r

item.title: Adding a group tag
item.description:
Group tags enable you to tag a group in relation to a particular project/themed piece of work your organisation is undertaking.  

NB.  Unlike Keywords, the tag is attached to the entire group rather than individual contact.  It cannot be used for mailing.  

Why use group tags? 

There may be occassions when you need to understand the amount of work you have undertaken in a set period of time around a particular theme/project.  By using the Group Tag mechanism, it is easy to track and report on your wrok in this respect. 


read more
item.dc:creator: martin.r

item.title: Introduction to VCS Tracker
item.description:
A tailormade database

VCS Tracker is a tailor made database that supports the information and data needs of organisations offering a service to their local Voluntary and Community Sector (VCS).  It is a powerful tool that allows you to monitor, analyse and connect with your local VCS.  It features flexible reporting and activity tracking, as well as an intelligent mailing system that helps you to accurately target your communication with the local VCS.  All of your work can be recorded, making it easier than ever to prove your impact fo funders.


read more
item.dc:creator: martin.r

item.title: Saving your search
item.description: VCS Tracker enables you to save and export the list of groups/contacts that have been listed as a result of your search criteria by clicking on the 'Save List' button. You can then save this list as an excel file for future reference.
item.dc:creator: martin.r

item.title: Refining your search
item.description:
There are three main ways you can refine your search for groups/contacts on VCS Tracker.

Pick Keyword

The 'Pick Keyword' button (left of the screen) can be used to bring up a list of all those contacts listed under a particular keyword (see picture) (for more information on 'Keywords' click here).

Ad Hoc Query

The 'Ad Hoc Query' button (bottom left of the screen) can be used to create your own set of criteria from which to search for groups (see picture).  NEED TO GIVE AN EXAMPLE 


read more
item.dc:creator: martin.r

item.title: Basic search
item.description:
The most basic search function is situated at the top right-hand side of the screen.  Simply click on 'Search' and it will bring up a list of all the group records stored on VCS Tracker.  Alternatively, enter the group name you are searching for into the blank text box next to the 'search' button and click 'search' or 'enter' (see picture).


read more
item.dc:creator: martin.r

item.title: The main toolbar
item.description:
At the top of VCS Tracker, there is a toolbar containing a range of drop-down menus. 

PICTURE??

The main menus that you will find useful include 'Enquiries', 'Forms', 'Reports' and 'Help'.  


read more
item.dc:creator: martin.r

item.title: Searching data on VCS Tracker
item.description: VCS Tracker has a range of search functions available to help you search the wealth of data that is stored on the database.
item.dc:creator: martin.r

item.title: Report builder
item.description:
Introduction

 

 

Once again if data is being searched for use the financial year, use the ‘Report for Financial Year’ picker to specify which year is wanted.

You can also tick the box marked ‘Include income for last 5 years’ and the last 5 years financial will be included at the end of the report.

If your report includes fields marked as yes or no you can check the box ‘replace Y/N info with 1/0 for statistical analysis’ and you will then be able to easily count this data in Excel.


read more
item.dc:creator: martin.r
